form.page_subtitle: CWC Diagnostic: Danger Signs>Vomits everything he/she eats and drinks

field.name: Take Action: Vomits everything he/she eats and drinks
Assess the sick child completely.
Test child for malaria: If Positive; Give Malaria Pre-Referral Treatment: if Negative; proceed with care below
Record child’s clinical information in Child Health Records book “Green” book.
Counsel mother on pre-referral treatment and Referral and Refer
Administer appropriate pre-referral treatment after completing assessment and document:
Check for signs of dehydration: Restlessness, Irritability, Sunken eyes, skin pinch goes back slowly or very slowly [longer than 2 seconds].
If Dehydration is present
Prepare ORS
Advise mother to be giving frequent sips of ORS on the way to higher health facility, if child can take sips. If child vomits, wait for 10 minutes and then continue but do it more slowly
Advise mother to continue breastfeeding if still breastfeeding
Call health provider taking up care and arrange for transport
Fill out Referral Form & Refer the child to a health center or hospital IMMEDIATELY
NB: Strongly discourage promethazine [Phenegan] for a child who is vomiting
While waiting for transport:
Advise mother not to put the baby on her back so that she can observe her closely
Support the child’s head with a pillow or child’s cloth and handle child in the Sims or lateral position to prevent swallowing of vomitus
Teach mother how to keep the baby warm on the way to the health facility
Observe mother breastfeeding and counsel her on positioning and attachment if necessary. However, if urgent referral is needed, do not waste time counseling.
Counsel mother on feeding a sick child
Accompany mother and child to the health facility
Follow up with client after discharge from health center or hospital
